intro: Searsia crenata, commonly known as the silverleaf bush, is a deciduous shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, white flowers and distinctive, silver-gray leaves. The plant is adapted to dry conditions and thrives in well-drained soils. Its fruit is a small, woody capsule that splits open to release seeds. Searsia crenata is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
